extDescription.message: Recognizes and highlights various "Dark Patterns" on websites.

errorInvalidConfig.message: The internal pattern configuration of the extension is invalid. The Pattern Highlighter will not start.
errorInvalidConfig.description: The error message in case of an invalid internal pattern configuration.

buttonOnState.description: Display when the switch is turned on in the popup.

buttonOffState.description: Display when the switch is turned off in the popup.

buttonReloadPageForChange.description: Text for the button to reload the page after changing the activation status.

buttonRedoPatternCheck.description: Text for the button to repeat pattern highlighting on the page.

headingShowPattern.description: Heading in the popup for buttons to display individual pattern elements.

headingFoundPatterns.description: Heading in the popup for the list of found patterns.

headingSupportedPatterns.description: Heading in the popup for the list of supported patterns.

textMoreInformation.description: Text in the footer before linking to the dapde.de website.

infoExtensionStarted.description: Message in the console when the Pattern Highlighter has started on a page.

infoExtensionDisabled.message: The Pattern Highlighter is disabled for this tab.
infoExtensionDisabled.description: Message in the console when the Pattern Highlighter is disabled in a tab.

infoNumberPatternsFound.description: Message in the console indicating how many patterns were detected.

patternCountdown_infoUrl.description: URL explaining the Countdown Pattern on the dapde.de website.

patternCountdown_info.message: Countdown Dark Patterns create the impression (truthfully or falsely) that a product or service is only available for a limited time. This is visually represented by a running clock or bar. You can watch as the desired item slips away.
patternCountdown_info.description: Brief explanation of the Countdown Pattern.

patternScarcity_infoUrl.description: URL explaining the Scarcity Pattern on the dapde.de website.

patternScarcity_info.message: The Scarcity Pattern creates the impression (truthfully or falsely) that a product or service is available in limited quantity. Scarcity Patterns also exist in variants where the alleged scarcity is simply invented. Or it is at least not made clear whether the limited availability refers to the product as a whole or only to the portal visited.
patternScarcity_info.description: Brief explanation of the Scarcity Pattern.

patternSocialProof_name.description: Name of the Social Proof Pattern.

patternSocialProof_infoUrl.description: URL explaining the Social Proof Pattern on the dapde.de website.

patternSocialProof_info.message: The Social Proof Dark Pattern relies on social proof. Positive product reviews or activity notifications from other users are displayed directly. Often, these reviews or notifications are simply invented. But even authentic reviews or notifications influence purchasing decisions through clever selection and placement.
patternSocialProof_info.description: Brief explanation of the Social Proof Pattern.

patternForcedContinuity_name.description: Name of the Forced Continuity Pattern.

patternForcedContinuity_infoUrl.description: URL explaining the Forced Continuity Pattern on the dapde.de website.

patternForcedContinuity_info.message: The Forced Continuity Dark Pattern automatically extends free or discounted trial subscriptions â€“ but at a cost or a higher price. The design trick lies in the fact that the order form also visually suggests freeness and obscures the (automatic) subsequent costs.
patternForcedContinuity_info.description: Brief explanation of the Forced Continuity Pattern.

showPatternState.description: Display of the current pattern number in the popup for the 'Show Pattern' function.
